Oyunun hikayesi çok iyi 2004 yılına göre grafikleri çok iyi.

Klasik bir başyapıt.Oynamayan oyuncuyum falan da demesin.Gerek sunduğu hikaye,gerek çıktığı yıla devrim getirmesi ile HL3 ü bekletmesi ile :d Valve a bu oyun için minnettar olmaktan başka birşey yapamayız.
Still a great game to replay all these years later, can't wait to see what Half Life Alyx will bring.

When Half-Life (the original game) was originally released in 1998, it was an instant success and if you've played it and still haven't tried Half-Life 2, well, let's just say; your time has come again.

The most notable thing in Half-Life 2 is the gravity gun, which can function as an indirect weapon or a source of utility.

The source engine by Valve, brought along interactable physics objects and a ton of nifty features, which at the time of release, were incomparable to any other games or game engine capability.

The result of this, combined with gun-play, provides an action filled campaign that's both immersive and mystifying.

The game does not feature a lot of weapons from the original Half-Life, and this forces players to utilize the gravity gun more often and allows  your combat situations to be better approached without spraying and praying.

It isn't always about running and gunning or spraying and praying, because you have to solve quite a few puzzles in order to attain level progression.

Отличная игра даже для момента написания обзора (2019 год). Графика достаточно приемлемая, я бы даже сказал, что она хороша (особенно для 2004 года). Игра очень затягивает. По мимо обычных перестрелок в игре игроку предстоит, порой, решать небольшие головоломки, что добавляет разнообразия и дает время для передышки перед следующими перестрелками с противниками. Вообщем, рекомендую к покупке!

Half Life 2 is criminally overrated. 

This is hands down the worst video game I've ever played. Not one aspect of this game was enjoyable. It's a downright dogshit. I'll never be able to fathom the cult following behind this game, and never do I want to. Puzzles were childlike, combat was a shitshow with no reward, the storyline was chaotic garbage, leaving me with the feeling that nothing I did from start to finish mattered in any second of my time playing. I hated this game with an intense passion I've never felt before with another game. Truly a disappointment, and a mystery that I fail to comprehend. 

1/10.

Simply yes, picked up all the HL games summer 2018 as part of the Valve complete pack, I thought I'd be playing more CS:GO but now I'm a die-hard Half Life fan. This game combined with its episodes is the best game I've ever played. It has the best story and atmosphere I've seen in any media and the gameplay is nice enough to complement it well, though I feel parts of it could have been expanded on more or changed entirely, like the janky physics or poor weapon selection. Apart from that, I really can't tell you how out of everything else's league Half Life 2 is.

This one solidly earns its glowing #1 spot in my games list.
the singluar best game of the century.
Half Life 2 is a game you play

Want an classic first person shooter game?
Then the Half-Life Franchise is for you! Starting back from 1998 to 2007 this game managed to get to my heart quicker than any other game I have played since I have been a child. It's simply one of the games that I will never be able forget so easily as I did with others.

- Good Graphics?
Yes, for a game made in 2004 this game has pretty awesome graphics and details attached to it.

- Good Story?
This game has an insanely interesting story, back from 1998 when Half-Life was released until 2007 when the last episode of Half-Life 2 has been published, Half-Life 2: Episode Two. (Sadly Valve had to make HL: Alyx - VR Only, so RIP PC fans.)

- Great NPC AI?
Funny, I hadn't know that the NPCs actually had tactics until I found a video on youtube discussing about this matter. The AI for NPCs in both Half-Life 1 and Half-Life 2 is extremely intelligent beside other games, which makes this franchise unique for this simple reason.

I recommend this game to every FPS fan, 10/10 (Maybe HL3 or HL2:EP3 will see the light of day sometime.)

An excellent masterpiece of gaming history, made by the people who would go to make Steam.

Pros:
- Has aged amazingly over 15 years.
- Gunplay is extremely solid.
- Platforming feels great, nothing much like it.
- Unique physics and ragdolls (revolutionary stuff even to this day)
- Engaging story and characters seemlessly connected to the game.
- Spawned a mass of other Source titles and communities that would go to shape gaming as a whole.

Cons:
- Some of the missions have not aged as well over multiple playthroughs, looking at you Water Canal. Fun and engaging at first, but tiring and boring after 50 runs.
- Enemy and gun variety is far shrunk compared to prior Half-Life titles. No Xen weapons and nothing cobbled up by the scientists minus the Gravity Gun.
- The lower end ports of this title are a mess, go for either the PC original or the X360 Orange Box (which is honestly my prefered way of playing Valve's titles.)
